summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions on Western Sahara, particularly resolution 1108 (1997), 
and the Convention on the Safety of UN and Associated Personnel, 
Welcoming efforts to prevent and control HIV/AIDS in peacekeeping operations, 
Welcoming the Secretary-General's report (S/2000/131) and its recommendations, 
Supports continued efforts to implement the Settlement Plan and agreements for a 
referendum on Western Sahara's self-determination, 
 Notes concerns on achieving a smooth implementation and urges cooperation for a 
lasting solution, 
1. Extends MINURSO's mandate until 31 May 2000; 
2. Supports the Secretary-General's intention to have his Personal Envoy consult 
parties to explore a durable and agreed resolution; 
3. Requests a situation assessment from the Secretary-General before the mandate 
ends; 
4. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
